headline: Slow Cooker Steak Fajitas
description: Melt-in-your-mouth flank steak served right out of the slow cooker make a great family-style meal that lets guests build their own fajitas.
name: Slow Cooker Steak Fajitas
recipeIngredient: 1 green bell pepper, sliced into strips
1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips
6 large flour tortillas, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Cut flank steak into 6 equal portions and place in a slow cooker. Add tomatoes, onion, bell peppers, jalapeno pepper, garlic, chili powder, cumin, coriander, and salt.
Cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours, or on High for 4 to 6 hours, until steak is fall-apart-tender.
Remove steak and shred. Return to slow cooker.
Serve hot with tortillas and shredded cheese, allowing everyone to make their own fajita.

review.reviewBody: very easy to make, and extremely delicious

Definitely want more heat but can add at end. Pretty soggy meat and in description, you say serve with sour cream, guacamole, and/or salsa. In the picture you show cheese, green onions and sour cream. In the recipe you call for cheese . Very confusing.
I will give it a try üòú

Thank you so much! You basically confirmed what I thought I could do in a crockpot and great fajitas! Can't wait to make mine which I'll be putting on in a few mins, . Keep posting easy Mexican/Spanish/Latino recipes, because that's my absolute fav food!
I didn't love it. The flavor was good but the meat was tough and I didn't like the vegees out of the pot - too mushy.
My family loved these fajitas. I love to just put it in the slow cooker come home and dinner is done!
Nice and easy to cook in Crock Pot. Eat with warm tortillas and cheese.
This was Great only change I made was added a small can of hot green chilies.
I made this exactly to the recipe, amazing! so tender and delicious. I added crumbled queso fresco and it made them even better.

I‚Äôve been cooking since before they invented stoves. I make good grilled fajitas, but I needed quick and easy and set it and forget it. I made these per the recipe. These were amazing. My husband has asked me to make them again. A friend of mine (he‚Äôs Mexican) who is really critical about Mexican food came over, and he even commented how good they were. BUT...the leftovers were even more truly amazing! We made burritos with and without beans and rice, and they were so good. I had a bit still left, so I scrambled eggs and added cheese and made a breakfast burrito. Just excellent. I‚Äôve got a cooker going right now set to feed a bunch of teenage boy athletes. Highly recommend this recipe!!! Btw, I‚Äôll just hook up my pancake griddle to heat the flour tortillas when the boys are ready. I can do 8 at a time. Fast. Easy.

These had a decent flavor,but it wasn't something I want to try again,due to the heavy broth in the slow cooker that some would claim is the 'cats pajamas.' However the method of crockpot fajitas just didn't do it for us. I might try another reviewer suggestions and crisp the fajita meat in the broiler,or my cast iron skillet than place the meat in the slow cooker. I'm on the fence on this one!
I followed the recipe precisely. The fajitas were bland and the vegetables were over cooked.

Good lord! If you had asked me yesterday "what is the most labor intensive way to ruin a steak?" i would not know how to answer. But as i loaded beautiful pieces of flank steak into the crockpot it felt wrong. The end result was unappealing. I did not care for this recipe at all.

My whole family enjoyed it. I was worried about it being too spicy so I left out Jalape√±o pepper & added more chili powder. My daughter doesn‚Äôt like things too hot. Served on flour tortillas with refried beans & all the typical fajita sides. I just drained well before serving. Easy to make & I love the crockpot as my kids have different schedules with sports.
Was so good!
Easy, easy and easy...and tastes great.

This was very delicious! I was worried about the peppers being too soggy but they weren't. It was the perfectly blended amount of flavor and texture. I will definitely make this easy recipe again. It was a huge hit in my home.
Couldn‚Äôt be easier! I made is as written and won‚Äôt change a thing. It‚Äôs delicious! Thanks for sharing the recipe!

Could have used a bit more flavor but that could just be my personal preference since I like things with a kick.. I will add Rotel instead of the chopped tomatoes next time and see if that adds the little extra I am looking for.
Added a little bit of beef broth for some liquid. Big fan of this recipe.
Excellent! I expected a bit of a soggy mess, but this turned out to be delicious!!
Excellent! I made the recipe with some moderations but it is great. I used 1.5 thin cut steak, added a habenero diced and a second jalape√±o sliced. It‚Äôs css as me out great. Thanks

This recipe was just okay for me, and that is after I followed the advice of some other reviewers and did not add the tomatoes. The recipe just didn‚Äôt have the taste of grilling that sets fajitas apart.
So good and easy to make! Tender, juicy and so much flavor!

It was good, a little bland. Thinking next time to saut√© the onion and peppers first to bring out more favor. Maybe a second jalape√±o too as the one I used was not that big. Overall though it made a cheaper cut of meat good. I‚Äôll try it again.

I made this recipe. However, I used Beef fajita meat that‚Äôs seasoned, added my own seasonings I like & that I got from our City Market. I also chose to slightly saut√© my bell peppers and onions and then add them to the meat. I also am not a huge fan of flour tortillas, so I put the mixture over rice and my family absolutely loved it. I already had this idea in mind. But, the slow cooker option makes the meat more tender. Thanks for the slow cooker idea
Absolutely amazing! I showed this recipe to my mother and she loved it as well . We both have an added dish for our nightly menus!
Very good and tasty. Followed recipe and it came out great.

Flavours were fantastic and meat was tender but the whole dish was far too runny for wraps. I ended up popping the left over mixture into small ramikins, adding grated cheddar on top and then topping with puff pastry. As pies , it was delicious and j in would make it as a pie filling again but not as a filling in wraps

I didn't use the canned tomatoes and they were not missed. We had fresh cubed tomatoes to add as we were make our fajitas. Served with sour cream, shredded cheese and Guacamole. The only thing I found off putting about the recipe was the liquid, dripping into my plate. Glad I didn't add the canned tomatoes. Next time I will drain the fajitas out of the liquid before servicing.
I should have cut the shredded flank steak in small we pieces. Otherwise the flavor was very good!

Made it today (11/4/19) just as the recipe stated. Absolutely mouth watering. Everyone devoured it, including kids. My husband also had it on a delicious fresh roll and it was great. Highly recommend. 

I saw one review saying the tomatoes turned it into a soggy mess. It was definitely a very l√≠quidy consistency but I got a strainer spoon and strained it before putting it on the tortillas.
I would definitely recommend placing them on a cookie sheet and broiling them for 20 to 30 minutes to add a crispiness to the meal. JUST SAYING
Slow cooker was a nice touch. One always Grilled my streaks. Added the vegetables saut√©ed

Pretty dang Good! Thank you for sharing Your recipe. We added 1/2 juice from a lime. Drained off the juices before serving- Gone in 30 minutes! Ill make this again with a couple minor modifications. Add lime again and zest of 1 lime- personal preference.

I love to be able to put ingredients in a slow cooker and come home after a busy day to a great meal! These fajitas were delicious. I realized I had used my canned tomatoes already, so I substituted a can of Rotel tomatoes and omitted the jalape√±o pepper. My husband added chopped jalape√±os to his, but I‚Äôm a heat wimp and didn‚Äôt add them to mine. I did need to add a little more salt than what was called for.
